headline.seo: Mystery in the Caviar Tin: Some Labeling Is Misleading
headline.main: The Challenge of Knowing What’s Really in the Osetra Tin
headline.print_headline: The Challenge of Knowing What’s Really in the Osetra Tin

docs.snippet: Six sturgeon species, along with some hybrids, are being farmed for caviar, replacing familiar species that are not currently available in the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: FOR those who could afford it, buying caviar used to be simple. In descending order of price, there was delicate, prized beluga; nutty and sometimes golden osetra; and dark, assertive sevruga. Today, beluga is banned in the United States, and the harvest of wild osetra and sevruga from the Caspian and Black Seas for the international caviar market has been halted at least until February.
docs.abstract: Union Square Hospitality Group is creating buzz with Shake Shack, burger place with restaurateur Danny Meyer's deft touch; while Meyer has resisted expansion of his other establishments, Shake Shack appears destined to gain following, with outlets planned in several New York City locations and plans to expand to other cities; photo (M)

headline.main: The Challenge of Knowing What's Really in the Osetra Tin

docs.news_desk: Dining In, Dining Out / Style Desk

docs.snippet: Political and economic upheaval in Argentina has helped open the door for its neighbor Uruguay to claim the grass-fed mantle in worldwide beef sales.
docs.lead_paragraph: For decades, the cattle-raising family of Gabriel Pintos looked across the Río de la Plata with respect and envy at Argentina's legendary tradition for producing beef. But scanning the vast expanse of his 193-acre ranch here recently, where ducks quacked in a nearby pond while 120 cows nibbled on green grass, Mr. Pintos exuded a new competitive vigor.
docs.abstract: Political decisions by Argentina are threatening country's world-renowned beef industry; changes have driven away investors, reduced size of Argentina's herd and given neighboring Uruguay chance to cut into its market; more Argentine cattle are being fed grains on often-crowded feedlots, while Uruguay is billing itself as 'last big farm' for grass-fed cattle; about 80 percent of land in Uruguay is used for cattle grazing; Uruguayan beef industry is nevertheless struggling to compete with Argentina's well-established global reputation; photos; map (M)

headline.main: A Market for Beef Ambles Across a Border

byline.original: By ALEXEI BARRIONUEVO; Charles Newbery contributed reporting from Buenos Aires

headline.main: Lebanon: At Least 11 Die as Ship Sinks
headline.print_headline: Lebanon: At Least 11 Die as Ship Sinks

docs.snippet: Rescue workers searched stormy waters off Lebanon on Friday after a cargo ship sank, killing at least 11 people and leaving dozens missing. The cargo ship, which flew a Panamanian flag and carried thousands of sheep and other livestock, went down...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rescue workers searched stormy waters off Lebanon on Friday after a cargo ship sank, killing at least 11 people and leaving dozens missing. The cargo ship, which flew a Panamanian flag and carried thousands of sheep and other livestock, went down Thursday in heavy rain. A senior officer in the Lebanese Army said 33 people were still missing. Of the 83 crew members on board, 39 were rescued and 11 bodies were recovered, the officer said on the condition of anonymity because he was not authorized to speak to the news media. The crew members were from Britain, Australia, Russia, Lebanon, Syria, Pakistan, the Philippines and Uruguay, the state-run National News Agency reported. The ship, which was identified as the Danny F II, was believed to have been sailing from Uruguay to Syria.
docs.abstract: Rescue workers search stormy waters off Lebanon after cargo ship sank, killing at least 11 people and leaving dozens missing (S)

headline.main: Lebanon: At Least 11 Die as Ship Sinks

docs.snippet: For music fans, the hottest ticket for 2010 will be the Coachella festival in California.
docs.lead_paragraph: Forget the Winter Olympics in Vancouver or the World Cup in South Africa. For music fans, the hottest ticket for 2010 will be the Coachella festival in California. So says Jaunted, which in a recent post, announced both the festival's dates for 2010 and offered advice on how to get tickets.
docs.abstract: For music fans, the hottest ticket for 2010 will be the Coachella festival in California.
